Hi thereâ€”human, or alien.

Wherever you come from, whatever brings you here, the universe always arranges these wonderful encounters, so we meet at some coordinate in some space-timeâ€”a miracle with probability close to zero. It’s wonderful to meet you. May each of your days be warm, bright, and healthy.

As for me, I’m both ordinary and special among the inhabitants of this blue planetâ€”a clump of dust that has condensed into a thinking form. I carry some of the classic human glitches: impatient, easily ignited and explosive, kind of a mess but weirdly confident. But Iâ€™ve also got some rarer traits: a bleeding-heart empath, sentimentality, and I’m kind (at least I hope so ^^)

If you need labels to sketch out a rough silhouette of me, I suppose Iâ€™m made up of these fragments:

  • Feminist
  • ENFP / Aquarius
  • Collector of all things Pusheen
  • Horror film enthusiast, especially cult and slasher films (the type who covers their eyes while peeking through their fingers!)

Putting people into boxes is always inaccurateâ€”like trying to sum up the whole sea with just a few waves. Thereâ€™s so much more beneath the surface. Iâ€™ve scattered some of my thoughts around here. Youâ€™re welcome to take a look. But words are only reflections of who I am in certain moments. Like the moon mirrored on water, they arenâ€™t the moon itself. Iâ€™m always in motion, always becoming. What you read here captures only who I am nowâ€”not who I was, and not yet who Iâ€™ll be.

In a world where everything rushes forward so fast we barely have time to watch a flower bloom, human connection has grown strangely distant. We share meals, laughter, and moments with manyâ€”rarely does someone pause to ask, â€œWhatâ€™s been on your mind lately?â€ And rarer still: someone who stays to hear the whole answer. So we linger on the surface, where it feels safe. And slowly, we become each otherâ€™s most familiar strangers.

But me? Iâ€™m always curious:
How do you see this world? How do you understand life, existence, those ineffable things? We don’t need to ask the same questions, or even hold answers that contradict. What matters is that youâ€™re thinking, and Iâ€™m listening. After all, slowly approaching someone starting from thoughts is both luxurious and romantic, don’t you think?

So if youâ€™ve made it this farâ€”if youâ€™re willing to pause for just a few seconds and leave behind a small echoâ€”then that would be more than enough. Iâ€™ve always believed in the soft, invisible threads that connect one life to another: sincerity, kindness, understanding.
Theyâ€™re so much rarer, and so much more precious, than prejudice or hate.

To see and to be seenâ€”thatâ€™s the connection I cherish most. And the reason I persist in expressing myself.
